unnormalised: Grocery prices are still acting like they're auditioning for a Bollywood drama – full of unexpected twists and dramatic highs! The latest data shows a "slight" increase of 2.5% in the cost of tomatoes, making that 'tamatar chutney' dream a tad more expensive.
normalised: grocery prices are still acting like they're auditioning for a Bollywood drama full of unexpected twists and dramatic highs! The latest data shows a slight increase of two point five percent in the cost of tomatoes, making that tamatar chutney dream a tad more expensive.

unnormalised: Apparently, onions are feeling left out and decided to join the party, with prices up by a whopping 1.8%. Your 'aloo pyaaz ki sabzi' might need a government subsidy soon!
normalised: apparently, onions are feeling left out and decided to join the party, with prices up by a whopping one point eight percent. Your aloo pyaaz ki sabzi might need a government subsidy soon!

unnormalised: And don't even get me started on the price of lentils! That humble 'dal' is now retailing at Rs. 120/kg – which is almost as shocking as finding out your auto-rickshaw driver uses GPS.
normalised: and don't even get me started on the price of lentils! That humble dal is now retailing at rupee one hundred and twenty per kilogram which is almost as shocking as finding out your auto-rickshaw driver uses G-P-S.

unnormalised: But wait, there's a silver lining! At least, that’s what the shopkeeper told me. Apparently, the price of 'elaichi' (cardamom) has remained stable at Rs. 1500/kg. So, if you're planning on eating just cardamom for the next month, you're in luck!
normalised: but wait, there's a silver lining! At least, that’s what the shopkeeper told me. Apparently, the price of elaichi cardamom has remained stable at rupee one thousand five hundred per kilogram. So, if you're planning on eating just cardamom for the next month, you're in luck!

unnormalised: Overall, shopping for groceries is like playing the stock market – except you're investing in vegetables and hoping your wallet survives. Maybe it's time to start growing our own food on the balcony. #InflationBlues #GroceryShenanigans #India #PriceHike #JustKidding...SortOf
normalised: overall, shopping for groceries is like playing the stock market except you're investing in vegetables and hoping your wallet survives.
